p: Agriculture, often referred to as an open-air factory, is an economic activity that depends heavily on climate and certain weather conditions to produce food and many other goods necessary to sustain human needs. Moreover, agriculture is an activity that is exceptionally vulnerable to climate change and the impacts of climate change are characterized by various types of uncertainty [ 16]. Climate change is estimated to have both positive and negative impacts on agricultural systems at the global level, with negative impacts outweighing the positive ones [ 17]. Temperature increases, altered precipitation patterns, and increased CO 2 concentrations have a significant impact on ecosystems, ranging from species to ecosystem levels [ 18]. For this review, it is important to first explain the effects of climate change on crop production, as the effects of climate change on insect pests depend on the plant species on which these insects thrive and feed.
